sen.j: 九鬼 隆度（くき たかのり、寛政12年8月10日 (旧暦)（1800年9月28日）- 嘉永6年4月23日 (旧暦)（1853年5月30日））は、丹波国綾部藩の第8代藩主。
sen.e: Takanori KUKI (September 28, 1800 - May 30, 1853) was the eigth lord of he Ayabe Domain, Tanba Province.
Takanori KUKI (September 28, 1800 - May 30, 1853) was the eigth lord of he Ayabe Domain, Tanba Province.
Takanori KUKI (September 28, 1800 - May 30, 1853) was the eigth lord of he Ayabe Domain, Tanba Province.

sen.j: 第7代藩主・九鬼隆郷の長男。
sen.e: He was the eldest son of Takasato KUKI, the seventh lord of the domain.
He was the eldest son of Takasato KUKI, the seventh lord of the domain.
He was the eldest son of Takasato KUKI, the seventh lord of the domain.
His lawful wife was a daughter of Tadateru TORII.
His lawful wife was a daughter of Tadateru TORII.
His lawful wife was a daughter of Tadateru TORII.
He had a daughter (a wife of certain Kitano).
He had a daughter (a wife of certain Kitano).
He had a daughter (a wife of certain Kitano).

sen.j: 官位は従五位下、出雲国守、河内国守。
sen.e: His official court rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Izumo no kuni no kami (Governor of Izumo Province) and Kawachi no kuni no kami (Governor of Kawachi Province).
His official court rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Izumo no kuni no kami (Governor of Izumo Province) and Kawachi no kuni no kami (Governor of Kawachi Province).
His official court rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Izumo no kuni no kami (Governor of Izumo Province) and Kawachi no kuni no kami (Governor of Kawachi Province).

sen.j: 文化 (元号)5年（1808年）、父の死去により後を継ぐ。
sen.e: In 1808, he took over as head of family after his father's death.
In 1808, he took over as head of family after his father's death.
In 1808, he took over as head of family after his father's death.

sen.j: 文政5年（1822年）閏1月24日、弟の九鬼隆都を養嗣子として家督を譲り隠居。
sen.e: In February 15, 1822, he retired and handed over the headship of the family to Takahiro KUKI, his younger brother, by taking him as an adoptive heir.
In February 15, 1822, he retired and handed over the headship of the family to Takahiro KUKI, his younger brother, by taking him as an adoptive heir.
In February 15, 1822, he retired and handed over the headship of the family to Takahiro KUKI, his younger brother, by taking him as an adoptive heir.

sen.j: 嘉永6年（1853年）4月に54歳で死去した。
sen.e: He died in May 1853, at age of 54.
He died in May 1853, at the age of 54.
